summary: The Innovative and Safe Hydrogen Transportation Act, introduced in the Senate, directs the Secretary of Transportation to conduct a study on the use of composite materials in pipelines for hydrogen and hydrogen-natural gas blends. The study, to be completed within 18 months of enactment, will assess commercially available materials, existing data, and relevant standards. Public participation is mandated through meetings and a public comment period. The Secretary is then required to initiate a rulemaking allowing for the use of composite materials in pipelines within 18 months of a post-completion public meeting.
